title: Bedtime Yoga | 20 Minute Bedtime Yoga Practice | Yoga With Adriene
description:
This gentle bedtime yoga practice is a great remedy for anyone feeling stress, anxiety, or tension in the mind or body. Use this evening yoga practice to decompress, prepare for a good night's rest or simply use it any time of day to remedy the imbalance. Put on something comfy. Yoga to the rescue! Enjoy. 

For more relaxing bedtime yoga practices, check out our Bedtime Yoga playlist: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v7SN-d4qXx0&list=PLui6Eyny-UzxlcWgUFYAcnNInS3SNe6Fs


- - - - - - - - - -

channelDescription:
WELCOME to Yoga With Adriene! Our mission is to connect as many people as possible through high-quality free yoga videos. 
We welcome all levels, all bodies, all genders, all souls!
If you're brand-new to yoga, check out my Yoga For Beginners and Foundations of Yoga series. These are designed to give you the tools to build a happy, healthy at-home yoga practice. 
Do your best, be authentic, and FIND WHAT FEELS GOOD.
Jump on in! You don't even have to leave your house. 

Love, Adriene

comments: What is something you can let go of for today?
This 7 year old practice is truly the gift that keeps on giving

For almost the last 10 years, since I was a child, I've had severe anxiety. It's uncommon for me to get more than a few hours sleep a night, I have chronic pain from holding so much tension, and I have constant intrusive thoughts, and many panic attacks. I often have to take sedatives to even begin to relax my body. I thought I'd try this tonight and I cried mid way through because I could feel the tension leaving my body. I didn't think once about any of my worries, my fears, my 'failures' during the day. It is bliss to have even 20 minutes without them. This was perfect. Thank you.
While massaging my feet, I started thinking of where my feet had taken me the last 29 years. I couldn’t help but cry. It was such an intimate moment with myself. Thank you

Just wanted to pop on here and say: I've been using this video nightly for about a year now, and it has allowed me to start falling asleep at a normal bedtime and stop having PTSD nightmares. My mental health is improving, and I no longer have as much pain and tension in my shoulders and back. You are really transforming my life with this simple 20-minute practice. Thank you SO much for sharing!
